intro: Cnidoscolus piranii, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot or Piranha plant, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a waxy texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by edible, starchy tubers that are used in local cuisines. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and culinary uses, it is of interest to both botanists and food enthusiasts.
